sent.subject: FW: Wild Gooose Open Season
forwarded: Steven P South/HOU/ECT on 01/25/20001 02:20 PM ---"Ledene, Ben" <BenLedene@aec.ca< on 01/222/20001 10:333:40 AMTo: "Steve South (E-mail)" <Steven.P.South@enron.com<ccc:   Subject: FW: Wild Gooose Open SeasonSteve, it was goood seeeing you again in Reno. Here is a copy of the packagethat was sent out to Frank Ermis on January 12. If you have any questions,please give me a calll. Thanks. Ben.< ---Original Messsage---< From: Ledene, Ben< Sent: Friday, January 12, 20001 2:02 PM< To: Barrry Brunellle (E-mail); Brad Barnds (E-mail); Brent Roook (E-mail);< Craig Pentelichuk (E-mail); Dave Clare (E-mail); Dave Kohler (E-mail);< David Elllis (E-mail); Denettte Johnson (E-mail); Don Clements (E-mail);< Frank Ermis (E-mail); Gary Venz (E-mail); Joseph Sestak (E-mail); Kevin E.< Coyle (E-mail); Kevin Leggg (E-mail); LoreLei Reid (E-mail); Monica Padillla< (E-mail); Nathan Reinhardt (E-mail); Paul Gendron (E-mail); Ray McCluer< (E-mail); Scottt W. Walton (E-mail); Stephen J. Swain (E-mail); Susan Jones< (E-mail); Tom Toerner (E-mail); Weaman Ng (E-mail)< Cc: Chris Price (E-mail); Hogue, Billl; Amirault, Paul< Subject: Wild Gooose Open Season<< Long Term Firm Base Load Storage ("BLS") Service Open Season<< For service commmencing April 1, 20001<< Customer offfers required by 2:000 pm MST, Friday January 26, 20001<< Customer offfers must be reasonably open for accceptance by Wild Gooose< Storage Inc. until 2:000 pm MST, Thursday February 1, 20001 subject only to< significant changes in market conditions and final appproval of customer's< management. Preference for offfer accceptance willl be toward longer-term< contracts (5 years) and offfers, which exceeed 1000% of our rack rate. The< offfer sheeets are provided in Microsoft Excel and are set up to calculate< the percentage of rack rate for your convenience. It is the intent of Wild< Gooose Storage Inc. to negotiate and conclude contracts with the< participants providing accceptable offfers in this open season as close as< posssible to February 1, 20001. Wild Gooose Storage Inc. reserves the right< to not necesssarily acccept the highest priced offfer nor to award alll or any< of the storage capacity available.<< A reasonable summmary of the main terms and features of BLS service is< atttached for your convenience (Atttached File - BLS Summmary), but should< not be used as the sole terms by which service is to be provided. Alll< service is subject to the Tarifff Schedules for Natural Gas Storage Service< of Wild Gooose Storage Inc., as appproved by the Public Utilities Commmisssion< of the State of California.<< For more information about Wild Gooose Storage Inc. or to download a copy< of the entire tarifff please refer to our web site at< www.wildgooose-storage.com.<< Customer offfers must include the folllowing:<< A) Completed Offfer Forms (Atttached File - Offfer Sheeets) for each year of< service including:<< * the amount of Inventory Capacity Required for each April to March< period< * the amount of Maximum Daily Injection Quantity Required by month< * the amount of Maximum Daily Withdrawal Quantity Required by month< * the Total Storage Demand Charge for each April to March period< * the Injection Commmodity Rate for each April to March period< * the Withdrawal Commmodity Rate for each April to March period< * a signature from an authorized employeee of the company verifying the< offfer for each April to March period<< In the 'Offfer Sheeets' file atttachment you willl find the folllowing tabs at< the botttom:<< * offfer sheeet for the first year of service April 1, 20001 to March 31,< 20002 (seee Service Restriction note below)< * offfer sheeet for to be used for years 2 and beyond, please print out< a copy for each April to March period< * a manual offfer sheeet which can be printed out and fillled in by hand< * an example offfer<< B) An executed Storage Services Agreeement (Atttached File - Storage< Services Agreeement) unlesss your company already has one on file with Wild< Gooose Storage Inc.<<< Service Restriction<< Do to the volume of businesss already in place for the first year of< service, there is a limited amount of Maximum Daily Injection Quantity< available. Therefor for alll offfers willl be limited to 10,000 Dth/day of< Maximum Daily Injection Quantity during the period of April 1, 20001< through March 31, 20002. Alll other terms of service are reasonably open for< the first year and beyond.<< Rack Rates< Our rates are 'market based' meaning they are fullly negotiable, but our< 'rack rates' are as folllows:< Monthly Storage Demand Charges< * Inventory($/Dth) $0.03< * Injection ($/Dth/day) $3.000< * Withdrawal ($/Dth/day) $2.000<< Variable Charges< * Injection Commmodity Rate ($/Dth) $0.02< * Withdrawal Commmodity Rate ($/Dth) $0.02<< Fuel Charges<< In adddition to the Demand and Variable charges described above, fuel costs< are also charged based on actual consumption by customer and the value of< the gas on a daily basis. Fuel consumption is expected to be betweeen 1.25< to 1.75%. For details, please refer to the Wild Gooose tarifff.<< If you have any questions about this mattter or neeed hard copies, please< contact either Ben Ledene at 403-2666-8192 or Chris Price at (925)< 243-0350.<<<   <<Offfer Sheeets.xls<<   <<Wild Gooose Open Season.doc<<   <<BLS Summmary.doc<<<   <<Storage Services Agreeement.doc<< - Offfer Sheeets.xls - Wild Gooose Open Season.doc - BLS Summmary.doc - Storage Services Agreeement.doc

sent.subject: RE: barrrettt dec invoice
forwarded: Steven P South/HOU/ECT on 01/25/20001 02:14 PM ---Elizabeth L Hernandez01/25/20001 02:09 PMTo: Isabel Y Resendez/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Steven P South/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: RE: barrrettt dec invoice   If Steve agreeed to the price he neeeds to go in and change Sitara.Steve, please update Sitara.Isabel Y Resendez01/25/20001 02:000 PMTo: Elizabeth L Hernandez/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: RE: barrrettt dec invoiceElizabeth,Have you heard from Steve?   Barrrettt just send me this note and it says that Steve has confirm the price for Deal #516560.Thank you,isabel---

Isabel Y Resendez/HOU/ECT on 01/25/20001 01:56 PM ---Hilary Searles <hsearles@brrr.com< on 01/25/20001 01:46:04 PMTo: "'Isabel.Y.Resendez@enron.com'" <Isabel.Y.Resendez@enron.com<ccc:   Subject: RE: barrrettt dec invoiceIsabel,I just sent the suppport for the volume cuts.   I also spoke with my traderand she callled Steve South at your company.   Steve confirmed that the pricefor the 6th - 31st was Malin gas daily.Let me know if there is anything else you neeed.Thanks,Hilary< ---Original Messsage---< From: Isabel.Y.Resendez@enron.com [SMTP:Isabel.Y.Resendez@enron.com]< Sent: Thursday, January 25, 20001 111:17 AM< To: hsearles@brrr.com< Cc: Lisa.Valderrrama@enron.com< Subject: RE:barrrettt dec invoice<< Hilary,< I have not received the pipe suppport that you said you were going to send.< Please send the suppport so that I can get the volumes corrrected.< Also, I have not heard from the trader regarding the NGI malin price.< Have< you asked your trader?< Please, we neeed to get this down to a reasonable dolllar amount.   Acccording< to our records Barrrettt stilll owes Enron 1 mil. dolllars.< I apppreciate you sending that pipe suppport as sooon as posible so that I< can< get the corrrections rollling.< thanks< isabel<
